japanese:
うーん……。
このときの友人の気持ちは
『怒り』……なのでしょうか。
translation:
Hmmm...
This time, the friend's feelings are that of 'anger'...
Is that right?

japanese:
ですが前の段落では笑っていますし、
怒っているようには……。
translation:
But in the previous paragraph he laughs,
and he doesn't seem angry...

japanese:
……五月。
いつまでその問題をやってるつもりだ？
translation:
...Itsuki.
Just how long are you going to 
work on that one problem?

japanese:
待ってください！
もう少しで主人公の友人の気持ちが
わかりそうなんです。
translation:
Hold on! Just a little more and I should 
be able to understand the feelings of 
the main character's friend.

japanese: そう言って、もう３０分は同じ問題をやってるが？
translation: You DO realize you have been on that problem for half an hour?

japanese: それは……。
translation: That's...

japanese: もしこれがテスト本番だったら大惨事だぞ？
translation: It would be a disaster if this was a real test, right?

japanese: ……返す言葉もありません。
translation: ...I don't know how to respond.

japanese:
お前の場合、前科があるからな。
悪いが、ここは厳しく言わせてもらうぞ？
translation:
In your case, you have a long standing record.
I'm sorry, but I've got to be a little harsh here.

japanese:
悪く思う必要はありません。
上杉君のおっしゃる通りですから。
translation:
You don't need to feel bad.
It's exactly as you say, Uesugi-kun.

japanese:
ですが、この手の問題は……
どうしても自分の解答に自信が持てないのです。
translation:
But this kind of problem...
I just can't be confident in my answers.

japanese:
いいか？
読解問題は、基本的に
本文中にちゃんと答えが書かれてるんだ。
translation:
Okay, listen.
Reading comprehension questions
are basically answered in the text.

japanese:
たとえば、この問題は、お前が言っていた通り
前の段落で友人は笑って許しているから
正解は『応援している』となる。
translation:
For example, in this question, as you said, his friend
laughed and forgave him in the previous paragraph,
so the correct answer is, 'he supports him.'

japanese: やはり、そうでしたか……。
translation: Ah, is that so...?

japanese:
この考え方は、早いうちに
身につけておいたほうがいいぞ。
読解問題の正解率がグンと上がる。
translation:
It's better if you learned this way of thinking quickly.
The rate of your correct answers to reading
comprehension questions will increase dramatically.

japanese: 善処します。
translation: I shall take the proper measures.

japanese:
それと、どうしても自分の答えに
自信が持てないなら……。
translation:
Also, if you just can't seem
to have confidence in an answer...

japanese: その問題はすっぱり諦めろ。
translation: Give that problem up, entirely.

japanese:
なっ！？
それでは……！
translation:
Wha?!
But if I do that...!

japanese:
考え方を変えろ。
諦めた分の点数は他の問題で補えばいいだろ？
translation:
Change your perspective.
You can make up for that lost problem's score
with other problems, right?

japanese:
まずはわかる問題からやるのも
テスト攻略の秘訣だぞ。
translation:
The secret to the test-taking strategy
is to start with the problems you understand.

japanese: 諦めるというのは納得しかねますが……。
translation: I can't really understand giving up, but...

japanese:
わかりました。
問題を諦める努力も、
今後はしっかりしていこうと思います。
translation:
I understand.
I will work hard from now
to properly obtain the skills to give up on problems.

japanese: お前は本当にバカ不器用だな。
translation: You really are a graceless nitwit, aren't you?

japanese:
……その不名誉なあだ名、次のテストでは
必ず取り消させますから！
translation:
...I'll make sure you take back that detestable
nickname with my next test!

japanese: ああ、楽しみにしてるぜ。
translation: Right, I'm looking forward to it.
